commit_message:
Fix channel order

Got libcrypto.so.1.0.0 not found in samtools -- this should fix it.
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/76082662/samtools-shared-library-libcrypto-so-1-0-0-not-found

Replaced cutadapt with trim_galore

The trim_galore trimmer is more 'intelligent', and recognized the common
adapter sequences without the need to manually provide them in the
config file. The corresponding option in the config was also removed
accordingly.

Set snakemakeversion to 5.28, since 6.05 caused errors with conda envs

The newest Snakemake version has issues with the cutadapt environment,
seems that python does not find the module. Debugging is needed.
Therefore, fix Snakemake to the last working version for now.
Added generation of fasta file from ref genome for each region

Fix: remove non-variant sites when selecting variants

Otherwise, FastaAlternateReferenceMaker just keeps non-variant sites,
resulting in identical FASTA files including any and all variants, even
if they are not present for the specific sample.
Added missing rule file for create region fastas
Update README
added region fasta files creation
Added biallellic SNPs generation
Increase memory for filtering
Fix missing -V in combine_variants
Remove recursive option from git in docu
Add extra option to VC, update config to HpA

Initial commit to have the basic vc workflow

- Ripped out all parts from the tiger workflow not required for vc.
- Added gvcf variant calling and combining vcfs.
Update README on how to obtain upstream updates
Bump cutadapt version to 1.16 due to missing pigz dep

Force greedy scheduler

The newer snakemake versions use a new scheduler, which seems somewhat
buggy. Snakemake gets stuck when trying to resolve the dependency graph.
Therefore, force to use the greedy scheduler as the default option.
Increased cluster resources for read trimming and mapping
Modified rule execution order to force tiger input creation for all f2 samples

Workaround for plot creation

The script used in the rule tiger_create_genotype_plot is not very
stable and sometimes fails:

[1] "F2-14-1-008"
[1] "F2-14-1-008.pdf"
[1] "results/tiger_analysis/F2.14-1/rough_co/F2-14-1-008.rough_COs.txt"
[1] "results/tiger_analysis/F2.14-1/rough_co/F2-14-1-008.rough_COs.breaks.txt"
[1] "results/tiger_analysis/F2.14-1/rough_co_breaks_refined_corrected/F2-14-1-008.corrected.refined.breaks.txt"
[1] "results/tiger_analysis/F2.14-1/allele_frequencies/F2-14-1-008.input.corrected.frequencies_bmm.txt"
[1] "results/tiger_analysis/F2.14-1/hmm_model/F2-14-1-008_sliding_window.breaks.txt"
Error in rect(r$V2[r$V1 == chr], 0, r$V3[r$V1 == chr], 0.3, col = ifelse(r$V4[r$V1 ==  :
  cannot mix zero-length and non-zero-length coordinates
Execution halted

This needs to be fixed, but until then, use this workaround and not mark
the job as failed, since an (incomplete) pdf is produced nevertheless,
which can be viewed.
Increase mem and time for variant_calling_f2
moved tiger pipeline to localrules
Streamline getting started part of README
Increase mem for cluster job of f2 variant calling

Added branching if TIGER model generation fails

The model generation step can fail for low quality (not enough variants)
data. To allow the pipeline to continue, a branching step was added. If
this step fails, the pipeline skips this sample, and continues
nevertheless.
Adjust memory req for cluster

More strict version dependency to circumvent asyncio bug

This is a problem related to

https://github.com/snakemake/snakemake/pull/726

While this issue is going to be fixed, there is no harm in explicitly
requiring a newer version of Python.
Fix path issue

Add estimation of strict filtering parameters from distributions

Added a rule and a script to estimate the strict filtering parameters
based on the distributions of the respective fields.

Currently, the cut-offs are estimated from joint distributions of all
parental vcfs. This should be changed to per crossing distributions.
Update README
Added TE bed file and chromosome size file to TAIR10
Update README
workflow names fixing
add local option to workflow driver script
Added plotting, TIGER pipeline as submodule, rqtl output

Bugfixes to reproduce output of the original pipeline

A number of bugs was fixed in order to reproduce the output of Uli's
original script.

In particular, there was a missing exclusion of non-PASS variants, and
a wrong input file for the hmm probabilities calculation.

When tested on 2 F2 samples, the final output of one was the same as for
the original script, and the other was not the same but close.

Commit after 1st complete run

- Bugfixes to have a complete run.
- Added localrules

Initial commit

The dryrun with snakemake -n works, but no tests as to whether the
workflow actually works done yet. Some debug work expected.
